subject: RE: [junit] testing void methods
msgSnippet: What does the void method do?  Your test will need to verify somehow that the method is doing what it s supposed to be doing.  If the method performs actions
messageBody:
What does the void method do? Your test will need to verify somehow
that the method is doing what it's supposed to be doing. If the method
performs actions on object passed into it (or into the constructor for
the class containing the method), then the test can use mock objects to
set expectations for the objects it passes in to verify that the method
is performing the correct actions. If there is no way to verify that
the method performed its necessary actions, then some amount of redesign
may be in order.

..David..

________________________________

From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of
abhishek sao
Sent: Thursday, December 08, 2005 2:54 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] testing void methods


Hi all,

I have just started using junit. I need to know that is there any way
by which i can test a void method? The only test cases I have written
till now were for methods that returned some methods and i used to check
the value using assertequals(). But how do I do it for a void function.

Somebody, please help me...
